intro: Minuria macrocephala, commonly known as the large-headed minuria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, elliptical seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
